content.description: Sit start with a loaf pinch and a high-ish right hand in the crack (or lower on a jug). Climb up the two converging cracks. Fairly dirty at the moment, especially up high, but fun movements on pretty good holds. Don't fall from the top.
content.protection: Pad(s), spotter would be nice in case of injury. Getting back to the parking lot from here isn't trivial.
content.location: On the far downstream end of the cliff, where the face turns uphill. The cliff faces downstream where this problem is located.

content.description: The Shelf is the first proud cliff line encountered in River Left. Ranging from 15-30 feet high and around 100 feet long, there are a number of potential lines to be had, from easy to not so easy. Most lines are accessed by a narrow mossy shelf at the base of the cliff, so beware that landings aren't great. It'd probably be advisable to bring a rope. There are also some boulders on the top of the cliff and on the downstream side.
